ETYMOLOGY: From Latin terminus 'end, boundary' and Greek -logia 'study, discourse'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The set of specialized terms or expressions used in a particular field, subject, or profession.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于特定领域、学科或专业的一套专门术语或表达方式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The legal terminology can be very challenging for those without a law background.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 对于没有法律背景的人来说，法律术语可能非常具有挑战性。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The study of terms and their use, particularly in specialized fields.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 术语学；对术语及其使用的研究，尤其是在专业领域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: As a subfield of linguistics, terminology is concerned with the systematic collection, description, and presentation of terms.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 作为语言学的一个分支，术语学关注术语的系统收集、描述和呈现。
